content: Is it healthier to eat whole grain bread instead of white bread?

Yes, whole grain bread is generally considered healthier than white bread. Whole grains contain all parts of the grain: the bran, germ, and endosperm. This makes them higher in fiber, vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants compared to white bread, which is made from refined grains that have had the bran and germ removed, leaving only the starchy endosperm. The higher fiber content in whole grain bread can help you feel fuller for longer, aiding in weight management, and may also reduce the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and certain cancers.
